title_sort: george washington whitman to louisa van velsor whitman, 2 october 1864
title: George Washington Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 2 October 1864
text: Petersburg Va Oct 2d/64 Dear Mother,Here I am perfectly well and unhurt, but a prisoner. I was captured day before yesterday with Major Wright, Lieuts Pooley, Cauldwell, Ackerson, Sims, and nearly the entire Regt. that was not killed or wounded  Lieut Butler was badly wounded  I am in tip top health and Spirits, and am as tough as a mule and shall get along first rate,  Mother please dont[don't] worry and all will be right in time if you will not worry  I wish Walt, or Jeff would write to Lieut. Babcock of our Regt (who is with the Regt) and tell him to send my things home by express, as I should be very sorry to lose them. G. W. WhitmanLieut Pooley is here and unhurt. George Washington Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 2 October 1864
